page.title: 06ST.CADOC'S RAGLAN
page.content: {ST.CADOC'S RAGLAN St.Cadoc's is a sheltered home for elderly people and is owned by Monmouth District Council.It was opened in 1970 by the secretary of state for Wales.There are twenty three flats sixteen have one bedroom and the others are bedsits.At the present time there are twenty ladies and three gentlemen.They have their own furniture and televisions.They do their own shopping and cleaning although some have meals on wheels.Mrs Langley the warden has a daily round and is on duty until 5o'clock after which a computer consul in Caldicot takes emergency calls.The oldest resident is ninety and the youngest sixty three.If an elderly person becomes ill they either go into hospital or are sent to their famlies. They have planned outings & functions.
